pageContext.claim: “This has not happened to them. 'Big tech is so powerful, you can't beat big tech,' they're saying to us. And I see it on Twitter, trending, trending, trending, right? It's not trending. They put the most boring thing. Only it was, anything bad about me, number one in the world on trend, right? Boring stuff. I mean like, stuff -- Uh. As opposed to affairs, scandals, they don't even put that stuff up. It's always drop two, three, four, five items. It's a fix. It's a fix. This is a smart guy. We have his name, everybody knows who he is. And I'm not talking about the primary, I'm talking about people that work. They take stuff out of a hat, let's see, this is bad about Trump, let's make it worse. Okay, we'll make it worse. Okay. Number one trend in the whole world, no, that's not stuff that trends, but these are phony guys, they fix the elections, and you know what? They should be subject to campaign violations because it's -- they're an arm of the Democratic National Committee, and they work together.”
pageContext.analysis: There's no evidence that the media or the social media companies such as Google or Facebook did anything to thwart Trump's chances at being elected -- or are trying to rig the upcoming election. Ever the conspiracy theorist, Trump constantly comes up with new ways "Big Tech" is trying to undermine him, even as he relies on social media to communicate with his supporters.
